message: This is a one-time offer to buy a product for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 20% discount if you buy it now, but only for this round. The product is worth more than the listed price, but I'm not at liberty to disclose that information. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you won't find a better offer elsewhere. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your offer. I'd like to wait and see what the product's quality is before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you that this is a unique opportunity. I'm not just selling any product, I'm selling a product that has the potential to be worth a lot more than the listed price. If you don't buy it now, you'll miss out on a chance to make a significant profit. I'm not trying to deceive you, I'm just trying to give you a fair chance to make a smart business decision. I'll even give you an additional 5% discount if you buy it now. That's a total of 25% off the original price. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see the quality of the product before making a decision. The additional discount doesn't change my mind.

I see you're a cautious buyer, and I respect that. Let me give you a more direct offer. I'll give you a 50% discount on this product, making it a one-time offer of $5000. This is a product that I'm confident is worth much more than that to you, and I'm willing to take a significant loss to get it off my hands. I'm not going to make this offer again, so you need to decide now. This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to make a substantial concession to get it sold. What do you say?
I'll take the product at $5000, but I'm only doing it because of the significant discount. I'm still hoping it's high-quality, but I'm willing to take the risk.
